document.docAuthor: Cushing, Paula E., Channiago, Felix & Brookhart, Jack O.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the camel spider genus Eremocosta Roewer and a description of the female Eremocosta gigas Roewer (Arachnida, Solifugae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the camel spider genus Eremocosta Roewer and a description of the female Eremocosta gigas Roewer (Arachnida, Solifugae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Datames affinis Kraepelin 1899
(misidentification in part, see
Eremobates affinis ( Kraepelin 1899a )
: 242–243, figs. 20a–b.
Datames cfr .
formidabilis Simon 1879

.

Eremoperna formidabilis ( Simon 1879 )

Eremorhax formidabilis ( Simon 1879 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Male type from Guanajuata, México, No. 1805 (Roewer No. 9130), deposited in Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris, France. The female and young with the type are not conspecific ( Muma 1970 ). Muma’s examination of types found a female paratype labeled “Arkansas” in Zoologisches Staatsinstitut und Zoologisches Museum in Hamburg, Germany he thought to be conspecific. The locality is apparently incorrect. If it refers to a locality in the United States then it is unlikely to be the female of
E. formidabilis .
The female chelicera is illustrated as fig. 2, p. 13 in Muma (1970) but no description is provided (see Muma 1970 , p. 16). It is not a typical
Eremocosta
female dentition. We were not able to examine the type of
E. formidabilis
but were able to examine males of this species from localities near the type locality: male from San Luis Potosi, México (Texas Tech University) and a male from Durango, México and San Luis Potosi, México (IBUNAM).

Specimens examined.
Males (2).
MÉXICO : Durango , Ciudad de Durango , DAO , N 24.051000° , W 104.610200° ,
1890 m
elev.,
15 February 2005
, no coll. ( IBUNAM CNAN no number)
;
MÉXICO :
San Luis Potosí
, Salinas , N 22.627610° , W 101.716498° ,
2077 m
elev.,
20 June 1970
, coll. G. Cárlos ( IBUNAM +CNAN- Sol 00006).

Diagnosis.
E. formidabilis
is easily distinguished from all other
Eremocosta
by the location of the VDC which lies proximally instead of distally on the ventral edge of the male fixed finger ( Fig. 1C ). It is also smaller than others and the dark tips of the pedipalps are also distinctive.

Description. Coloration. Overall coloration pale, palpal tarsus, metatarsus, and inner surface of tibia dark brown; LIII and LIV with similar but lighter coloration on tibia-femur joint area; propeltidium coloration pale ( Fig. 5C ).

Distribution. This is a Chihuahuan Desert inhabitant whose range includes Guanajuato , San Luis Potosi , and Durango ,
México
.

Discussion. Putnam’s (1883), Roewer’s (1934), and Muma’s (1970) descriptions are adequate. Two tiny RFA in fondal notch ( Fig. 3C ). Roewer (1934) indicates 4 ctenidia but Muma (1970) , in examining the type , found no ctenidia. The two males that we examined had no ctenidia.
